sentences: Erik Sven Fernström (15 April 1942 – 25 March 2018), known by his stage name Jerry Williams, was a Swedish singer and actor.
Williams grew up in a working-class family in Solna.
Williams' mother, a nurse, died when he was only twelve years old.
He was also a member of Narva BK, a boxing club.
He did his mandatory military service in 1966.
In 1962, Williams joined The Violents, a Swedish band that was formed in 1959 influenced by the English instrumental guitar group The Shadows.
When Little Richard performed at the Star-Club in Hamburg in 1962, both Williams along with The Violents and The Beatles were opening acts.
In the 1960s, Williams recorded a track with English record producer Joe Meek.
In the Eurovision Song Contest of 1989, he was a part of the choir for the song "En dag" which was performed by Tommy Nilsson representing Sweden.
Also in 2013, Williams co-operated with opera singer Malena Ernman on the latter's album I decembertid.
Williams had been married since 1977, and had two daughters from that marriage.
Williams died from cancer in Täby on 25 March 2018, aged 75.
